Breeding adult.description: Neotropic Cormorants are smaller with a longer tail. The area in front of the eye is covered by feathers instead of bare facial skin as it is on Double-crested Cormorants.
Brandt’s Cormorants are slightly larger with a shorter tail. Adults have bright bluish facial skin that Double-crested Cormorants do not have.
Pelagic Cormorants are smaller, with very thin necks, a tiny head, and a slender bill. Breeding adults show large white hip patches in flight that Double-crested Cormorants do not have.

Great Cormorants are larger and thicker overall with bigger heads than Double-crested Cormorants. Breeding adults have prominent white flank patches and a white patch around the bill that Double-crested Cormorants lack.

Adult male.description: Anhingas are more slender with a longer, straighter bill and longer tail than Double-crested Cormorants.

Adult.description: In flight at a distance, Canada Geese can look similar to Double-crested Cormorants, but goose flocks don’t change shape as much, and geese don't pause flapping as cormorants do.
